awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Improved Statistical Methods for     Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy
awd_abstract_narration: Magnetic resonance spectra, used in scientific, engineering                and medical research, depart from pure Lorentzian behavior in the               presence of inhomogeneities such as those commonly encountered in               many of these applications.  This research will develop                         appropriate analytic methods using statistical theory drawn from                semiparametric model analysis.  This new methodology will be                    derived to remove distortions caused by magnetic field                          inhomogeneity and by temporal instability.  Also, statistical                   theory and methodology will be developed to analyze repeated                    observations such as those taken to identify and study metabolic                changes at intervals during an extended period of time.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
